page.title: 19 The Changing Village...cont
page.content: At Milton Common the householders have been affected by the building of the M40 close to their homes.In particular they have to endure considerable traffic noise and exhaust fumes 24 hours a day.The lessening of traffic on the A40 has resulted in further ribbon development on sites close to the road.Those concerned with service industries have gained additional business from the motorway. In general Village shops have closed due to competition from supermarkets elsewhere.In Haseley The Post Office opens for one hour only on Thursday mornings.The travelling shop and fish and chip van are eagerly greeted by the villagers.They also support the mobile library van which comes once a week. The village pub is traditionally a centre of village life. by G.L.Walker.
